title: Active Learning-Based Deep Learning Application for MR Spectroscopy Quantification

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary statistics, linear algebra, and fundamental principles of MR spectroscopy
context.additional_context: A course for professionals in medical imaging analysis to improve MR spectroscopy data processing skills.

learning_goals: Learners can explain preprocessing steps for applying 1D/2D spectroscopy data to deep learning models.
Learners can improve the accuracy of MR spectroscopy quantification models by over 15% using ensemble network design principles.
Learners can implement methods to evaluate model prediction precision in low signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) environments by applying active learning techniques.
Learners can write a comparative analysis report on deep learning-based quantification results and traditional model-fitting (MF) results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
